net.uniform.api

Interface Validator<T extends Element>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Type of element supported by this validator
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlphanumericValidator, DateValidator, InSetValidator, MultipleOptionValidator, NumberOfSelectedOptionsValidator, NumericValidator, RegexValidator, RequiredValidator, SingleOptionValidator, StringLengthValidator

    public interface Validator<T extends Element>

    A validator can be added to an Element to extend its validation logic.

    A set of basic validators are included in Uniform in the package net.uniform.html.validators

    Author:
    Eduardo Ramos
    See Also:
    Element

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean breakChainOnError()
      Indicates if this validator returning any error should prevent next element validators from being called.
      List<String> getValidationErrors(T element, List<String> value)
      Returns the validation errors for the element data, if any.

    • Method Detail

      • getValidationErrors

        List<String> getValidationErrors(T element,
                                 List<String> value)
        Returns the validation errors for the element data, if any.
        Parameters:
        element - Element to validate
        value - Current list of values for the element
        Returns:
        List of errors (may be empty) or null

      • breakChainOnError

        boolean breakChainOnError()
        Indicates if this validator returning any error should prevent next element validators from being called.
        Returns:
        True to stop next element validators on error, false otherwise
